text: Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ by the commandment of God, our Saviour and the Lord Jesus Christ, our hope,
speaker: Narrator

text: unto Timothy, true son in the faith, Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even as I besought thee to remain at Ephesus when I went into Macedonia, that thou might charge some that they not teach diverse doctrine,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which generate questions other than that the edification of God is by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart and of a good conscience and of faith unfeigned:
speaker: Narrator

text: from which some, having swerved, have turned aside unto vanity of words,
speaker: Narrator

text: desiring to be teachers of the law, understanding neither what they say nor from where they affirm.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we know that the law is good, if a man uses it legitimately,
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing this, that the law is not made for a righteous man, but for the lawless and disobedient, for the ungodly sinners, for the evil and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,
speaker: Narrator

text: for fornicators, for homosexuals, for kidnappers, for liars, for perjured persons, and if there is any other thing that is contrary to sound doctrine,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to the gospel of the glory of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has enabled me, for he counted me faithful, putting me into the ministry,
speaker: Narrator

text: who was before a blasphemer and a persecutor and injurious, but I was received unto mercy because I did it ignorantly in unbelief.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the grace of our Lord was exceedingly abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a faithful saying and worthy of acceptation by all, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am first.
speaker: Narrator

text: But for this cause I was received unto mercy that in me first, Jesus Christ might show forth all clemency, for an example to those who should hereafter believe in him for eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore unto the King forever, immortal, invisible, the only wise God, be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This charge I commit unto thee, son Timothy, so that according to past prophecies regarding thee, that thou by them might war a good warfare;
speaker: Narrator

text: holding fast faith and a good conscience, which some, having cast away, have shipwrecked in their faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: Of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have delivered unto Satan that they may learn not to blaspheme.
speaker: Narrator

text: I exhort therefore, that, first of all, suppli­cations, prayers, intercessions, and giving of thanks, be made for all men,
speaker: Narrator

text: for kings, and for all that are in authority that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and integrity.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is good and pleasing in the sight of God our Saviour,
speaker: Narrator

text: who desires that all men be saved and come unto the knowledge of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is only one God and likewise only one mediator between God and men, the man Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who gave himself in ransom for all, the testimony of which was confirmed at the time,
speaker: Narrator

text: of which I am ordained a preacher and an apostle (I speak the truth in Christ and do not lie), a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and verity.
speaker: Narrator

text: I desire, therefore, that the men in every place, pray, lifting up holy hands, without wrath and strife.
speaker: Narrator

text: In like manner also that the women adorn themselves in an honest manner, with shyness and modesty, not with ostentatious hair or gold or pearls or costly clothing
speaker: Narrator

text: but with good works (as becomes women professing godliness).
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the woman learn, becoming silent in all subjection.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I do not allow a woman to teach, nor to usurp authority over a mature man, but to be at rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Adam was formed first, then Eve.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adam was not deceived, but the woman was deceived in the rebellion;
speaker: Narrator

text: notwithstanding she shall be saved in childbearing, if she continues in faith and charity and sanctification and modesty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Word is faithful, If anyone desires the office of a bishop, {to be a pastor or elder in the congregation} he desires a difficult ministry.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is expedient, therefore, that the bishop be blameless, the husband of only one wife, vigilant, temperate, of worldly affections mortified, given to hospitality, apt to teach;
speaker: Narrator

text: not given to wine, not hurtful, not greedy of dishonest gain, but gentle, not contentious, not covetous;
speaker: Narrator

text: one that rules well his own house, having his children in subjection with all integrity;
speaker: Narrator

text: (for if a man does not know how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of God?)
speaker: Narrator

text: not a novice, lest being puffed up, he fall into judgment of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover he must have a good report of those who are outside lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise the deacons must be honest, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of dishonest gain;
speaker: Narrator

text: holding the mystery of the faith together with a pure conscience.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let these also first be proved; then let them minister, if they are blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wives likewise are to be honest, not slanderers, temperate, faithful in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the deacons be the husbands of only one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those that minister well purchase to themselves a good degree and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I tarry long, that thou may know how it is expedient to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} of the living God, the pillar and base of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Spirit speaks expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from the faith, listening to spirits of error and doctrines of demons;
speaker: Narrator

text: that in hypocrisy shall speak lies; having their conscience seared as with a hot iron;
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall forbid to marry and shall command men to abstain from foods, which God has created to be received with thanksgiving by those who are faithful and have known the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everything that God created is good, and nothing is to be refused, if it is received with thanksgiving,
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou put these things before the brethren, thou shalt be a good minister of Jesus Christ, nourished up in the words of faith and of good doctrine, unto which thou hast attained.
speaker: Narrator

text: But refuse profane and old wives’ fables, and exercise thyself rather unto godliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For bodily exercise profits a little, but godliness is profitable unto all things, having promise of the life that now is and of that which is to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Word is faithful and worthy of acceptation by all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this we both labour and suffer reproach, because we trust in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, specially of those that believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Command and teach this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no man despise thy youth, but be thou an example of the faithful in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith, in purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I come, occupy thyself reading, exhorting, teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Neglect not the gift that is in thee, which is given unto thee to prophesy, through the laying on of the hands of the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Occupy thyself in these things with care, for in this is everything, that thy profiting may be manifest unto all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take heed unto thyself and unto the doctrine; be diligent in this, for in doing so thou shalt both save thyself and those that hear thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rebuke not an elder, but intreat him as a father, and the younger men as brethren,
speaker: Narrator

text: the elder women as mothers, the younger as sisters, with all purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour widows that are widows indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any widow has children or grandchildren, let those learn first to govern their house in piety and to recompense their parents, for this is honest and pleasing before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now she that is a widow indeed and desolate, trusts in God, and is diligent in supplications and prayers night and day,
speaker: Narrator

text: but she that lives in pleasure is dead while she lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore command these things, that they may be blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any provide not for his own and specially for those of his own house, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a widow be placed on the list being not less than sixty years old, having been the wife of one man,
speaker: Narrator

text: having a good testimony of good works, if she has brought up well her children, if she has exercised hospitality, if she has washed the feet of the saints, if she has relieved the afflicted, if she has diligently followed every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the younger widows refuse, for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they desire to marry,
speaker: Narrator

text: having condemnation, because they have cast off their first faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And reject also the idle, who have learned to wander about from house to house, and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.
speaker: Narrator

text: I desire therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, govern the house, giving no occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: For some are already turned back after Satan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any faithful man or woman has widows, let them maintain them and let not the congregation {Gr. ekklesia – called out ones} be charged, that it may relieve those that are widows indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let the elders that govern well be counted worthy of double honour, especially those who labour in the word and doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treads out the grain. And, The labourer is worthy of his reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Against an elder do not receive an accusation, unless there are two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those that persist in sin rebuke before all, that the others may also fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: I charge thee before God and the Lord Jesus Christ and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lay hands suddenly on no one, neither be partaker of the sins of others; keep thyself pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach’s sake and thine often infirmities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some men’s sins are manifest beforehand, before they come unto judgment, but to others they follow after.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also the good works of some are manifest beforehand, and those that are otherwise cannot be hid.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all that are under the yoke of slavery count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and his doctrine not be blasphemed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those that have faithful masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren, but rather serve them better, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. Teach and exhort this.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone teaches otherwise and does not consent to wholesome words, even the words of our Lord Jesus Christ and to the doctrine which is according to godliness,
speaker: Narrator

text: he is puffed up, knowing nothing, but is driven mad concerning questions and controversy of words, of which comes envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,
speaker: Narrator

text: perverse disputings of men of corrupt understanding, and destitute of the truth, using piety as a source of gain: from such withdraw thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But piety with contentment is great gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that, sustenance and covering, let us be content with this.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those that desire to be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and hurtful lusts which drown men in destruction and perdition.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of money is the root of all evil, which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: But thou, O man of God, flee these things and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, charity, tolerance, meekness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, unto which thou art also called, having made a good profession before many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give thee charge in the sight of God, who gives life to all things and before Christ Jesus, who testified before Pontius Pilate a good profession;
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou keep the commandment without spot, unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: who in his time shall show the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;
speaker: Narrator

text: the only one who has immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto, whom no man has seen nor can see, to whom be honour and power everlasting. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Charge those that are rich in this world, that they not be highminded, not placing their hope in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who gives us richly all things to enjoy;
speaker: Narrator

text: but charge them to do good, that they be rich in good works, liberal to distribute, willing to communicate,
speaker: Narrator

text: laying up in store for themselves a good foundation against the future, that they may lay hold on eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, turn away from profane voices and vain things and arguments in the vain name of science,
speaker: Narrator

text: which some professing have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
